questions.question_text: Which of the following strategies provides the BEST response to a ransomware attack?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Explanation:
Real-time off-site replication: This strategy involves continuously copying data to an off-site location in real-time. This ensures that the most recent data is always available and can be quickly restored in case of a ransomware attack. Real-time replication minimizes data loss to the shortest possible time frame, as data is constantly being backed up as changes are made.

Selected Answer: B
Trick question, A is replication, you are replicating the encrypted data. with incremental you don't overwrite a good back-up. You may loose a days worth of data.
the correct answer in my view is incremental backup. real-time replication would replicate the encrypted file systems to the site. full backup would take longer to recover.
If it's ransomware, wouldn't a real-time off-site backup just copy the maliciously encrypted files to the off-site location?

Selected Answer: A
A. Real-time off-site replication
Real-time off-site replication involves continuously replicating critical data to an off-site location, ensuring that an up-to-date copy of the data is available in case of an attack. This approach minimizes the potential data loss and reduces the downtime caused by a ransomware incident. It allows for quick restoration of systems and data from the replicated copies, enabling the organization to resume normal operations as soon as possible.

Answer is A. Real-time off-site replication
Real-time off-site replication provides the best response to a ransomware attack because it constantly updates a copy of your data in a separate, secure location. This allows for faster recovery in the event of a ransomware attack, as you can quickly restore your systems and data from the replicated copy without having to rely on potentially outdated or compromised backups. Additionally, having off-site replication adds another layer of protection against data loss due to physical damage or other site-specific issues.
D is the the best answer
